017package org.apache.commons.chain.web.servlet;
018
019import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
020
021import org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog;
022import org.apache.commons.chain.Command;
023import org.apache.commons.chain.Context;
024import org.apache.commons.chain.generic.LookupCommand;
025
026/**
027 * {@link Command} that uses the "path info" component of the request URI
028 * to select a {@link Command} from the appropriate {@link Catalog}, and
029 * execute it. To use this command, you would typically map an instance
030 * of {@link ChainProcessor} to a wildcard pattern like "/execute/*" and
031 * then arrange that this is the default command to be executed. In such
032 * an environment, a request for the context-relative URI "/execute/foo"
033 * would cause the "/foo" command to be loaded and executed.
034 *
035 * @author Craig R. McClanahan
036 */
037public class PathInfoMapper extends LookupCommand<ServletWebContext> {
038
039    // ------------------------------------------------------ Instance Variables
040
041    private String catalogKey = ChainProcessor.CATALOG_DEFAULT;
042
043    // -------------------------------------------------------------- Properties
044
045    /**
046     * Return the context key under which our {@link Catalog} has been
047     * stored.
048     *
049     * @return The context key for the Catalog.
050     *
051     * @deprecated Use catalogName to specify the name of the catalog in the
052     *             catalog factory.
053     */
054    @Deprecated
055    public String getCatalogKey() {
056        return this.catalogKey;
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * Set the context key under which our {@link Catalog} has been
061     * stored.
062     *
063     * @param catalogKey The new catalog key
064     *
065     * @deprecated Use catalogName to specify the name of the catalog in the
066     *             catalog factory.
067     */
068    @Deprecated
069    public void setCatalogKey(String catalogKey) {
070        this.catalogKey = catalogKey;
071    }
072
073    // --------------------------------------------------------- Command Methods
074
075    /**
076     * Look up the extra path information for this request, and use it to
077     * select an appropriate {@link Command} to be executed.
078     *
079     * @param context Context for the current request
080     *
081     * @return The name of the {@link Command} instance
082     *
083     * @since Chain 1.2
084     */
085    @Override
086    protected String getCommandName(ServletWebContext context) {
087        // Look up the extra path information for this request
088        HttpServletRequest request = context.getRequest();
089        String pathInfo =
090            request.getAttribute("javax.servlet.include.path_info").toString();
091        if (pathInfo == null) {
092            pathInfo = request.getPathInfo();
093        }
094
095        return pathInfo;
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * Return the {@link Catalog} to look up the {@link Command} in.
100     *
101     * @param context {@link Context} for this request
102     *
103     * @return The catalog.
104     *
105     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if no {@link Catalog}
106     *         can be found
107     *
108     * @since Chain 1.2
109     */
110    @Override
111    protected Catalog<ServletWebContext> getCatalog(ServletWebContext context) {
112        /* If the object returned from the passed context is not a valid catalog
113         * then we use the super class's catalog extraction logic to pull it
114         * or to error gracefully.
115         */
116        Object testCatalog = context.get(getCatalogKey());
117
118        /* Assume that the underlying implementation is following convention and
119         * returning a catalog with the current context.
120         */
121        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
122        Catalog<ServletWebContext> catalog = testCatalog instanceof Catalog
123                    ? (Catalog<ServletWebContext>) testCatalog
124                    : super.getCatalog(context);
125
126        return catalog;
127    }
128}
